sentences.english: In March, Hareton had had an accident and been confined to the farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 三月份，哈里頓發生了一起事故，並被囚禁在了農舍。

sentences.english: Or put my tongue in durance for to die?
sentences.chinese: 或者有什麼可以將我的口舌囚禁至死？

sentences.english: Thepeople cried out againsttheunjust imprisonment of the honest doctor.
sentences.chinese: 人們對不公正地囚禁那位正直的醫生表示強烈不滿。

sentences.english: He imprisons the dreamer in the world of the conscious mind and its values.
sentences.chinese: 他囚禁作夢者在意識心靈及其價值的世界裏。

sentences.english: He was prisoned for two years.
To protest against her illegal arrest, Nasrin has gone on several hunger strikes.
sentences.chinese: 爲了抗議自己的非法囚禁，納斯林已經絕食多次。

sentences.english: Daniel, this is the place where King Wen was jailed.
sentences.chinese: 大牛，這裏就是當年囚禁文王的地方。

sentences.english: Who were the emperors that have been thrown into prison at the Five-States period in Jin Dynasty?
sentences.chinese: 金時期五國城囚禁的兩個皇帝是誰？

sentences.english: It came as a joyous daybreak to end the long night of captivity.
sentences.chinese: 它來如一個快樂的黎明結束囚禁的長夜晚。

sentences.english: The solitude crossed with dream and with silence. Penned up between the sea and sadness.
sentences.chinese: 孤寂借夢和沉默穿過，在海與哀傷之間被囚禁。

sentences.english: According to legend, Saint Gregory had been kept for 13 years here.
sentences.chinese: 據說，聖格利高裏被囚禁於此13年。

sentences.english: Fear can hold you prisoner, hope can see you free.
sentences.chinese: 卻懦囚禁你的靈魂，希望還你自由。

sentences.english: Paktika province adjoins North Waziristan, a hub of militant activity. Several westerners kidnapped in Afghanistan have been held in Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 幾名在阿富汗被綁架的西方人都被囚禁在巴基斯坦。

sentences.english: The U. S. jailed people without trials in GuantanamoBay for over 5 years.
sentences.chinese: 美國不經審判就把人囚禁在關塔納摩達五年之久。

sentences.english: She recently passed her 5, 000th day in detention.
sentences.chinese: 她最近剛剛度過第5000個被囚禁的日子。

sentences.english: The world kept it prisoner on her throne.
sentences.chinese: “世界”便把“權利”囚禁在她的皇座上。

definition: to imprison/to place under house arrest
an execution/to put sb to death
cage used to hold or transport prisoners
to exile/to banish/to deport/to float (logs) downstream
to banish/to deport/to send into exile/to be marooned
